intro: Draba pedicellata var. wheelerensis, commonly known as Wheeler's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. It has basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, and its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer. This variety is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and habitat preferences.
